Item 1A. Risk Factors.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART I - Item 1A. Risk Factors section in bullet points:

• The TV streaming industry is highly competitive and rapidly evolving.
• Our ability to successfully grow revenues from advertising on our platform is uncertain.
• Maintaining an adequate supply of quality video advertising inventory on our platform is a challenge.
• Advertiser or advertising agency delayed payment or failure to pay can harm our business.
• Our ability to further monetize our streaming platform is uncertain.
• The non-renewal or early termination of agreements with content partners can be a risk.
• Decreased availability or increased costs for materials and components used in the manufacturing of our products can increase costs.
• Our reliance on contract manufacturers and limited manufacturing capabilities can lead to supply chain disruptions.

Item 1C. Cybersecurity.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 1C. Cybersecurity section of ROKU's company report, formatted as bullet points:

• ROKU has an enterprise-wide approach to risk management that includes cybersecurity as a critical component.
• The Board and Audit Committee oversee cybersecurity risks, with the Audit Committee assisting in reviewing significant cybersecurity matters and concerns.
• The Vice President of Product and Enterprise Security is responsible for overseeing the company's cybersecurity risk management program, with over 30 years of experience in cybersecurity and information technology roles.
• ROKU maintains a cybersecurity incident management procedure to address incidents involving its information systems.
• The company engages third-party firms to perform assessments of its cybersecurity measures and manages a bug bounty program.
• Cybersecurity awareness training is available for all employees, with enhanced training provided for certain employees.

Item 2. Properties.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART I - Item 2. Properties section of ROKU's properties in bullet points:

• The corporate headquarters of ROKU is currently located in San Jose, California.
• The lease for the corporate headquarters expires in September 2030.
• The space used for the headquarters is utilized for sales, research and development, and administrative purposes.
• ROKU leases office and shared work spaces throughout the United States and internationally.

Item 5. Market for Registrant’s Common E.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 5. Market for Registrant’s Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities section of ROKU's annual report:

• As of December 31, 2024, there were approximately 64 stockholders of record of our Class A common stock and 13 stockholders of record of our Class B common stock.

• Our Class A common stock is listed on The Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker symbol “ROKU.”

• We have never declared or paid any dividends on our Class A or Class B common stock, and we currently intend to retain all available funds for use in our business.

• None of the issuer or affiliated purchasers have purchased equity securities from us.

• The cumulative total stockholder return of an investment of $100 in cash from December 31, 2019 through December 31, 2024 is as follows:
 - Class A common stock: 14.23%
 - Nasdaq Composite Index: 63.15%
 - Peer Group (companies listed below): 57.13%

• The Peer Group consists of the following companies:
 - Alphabet, Inc.
 - Fox Corp
 - fuboTV, Inc.
 - Interpublic Group of Companies, Inc.
 - LiveRamp Holdings, Inc.
 - Magnite, Inc.
 - Meta Platforms, Inc.
 - Netflix, Inc.
 - Paramount Global
 - Pinterest, Inc.
 - Pubmatic, Inc.
 - Snap, Inc.
 - Tradedesk Financial Corp
 - Vizio Holding Corp
 - Walt Disney Co.
 - Warner Bros. Discovery, Inc.

• The stockholder return shown on the graph is not necessarily indicative of future performance.

Item 7. Management’s Discussion and Anal.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - Item 7. Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations section of ROKU's Annual Report, formatted as bullet points:

• The company has two reportable segments: platform segment and devices segment.
• Platform revenue is generated from digital advertising, streaming services distribution, and related services.
• Devices revenue is generated from the sale of streaming players, Roku-branded TVs, smart home products, audio products, and related accessories.
• The company expects to increase Streaming Households by managing average selling prices of Roku streaming devices.
• The key performance metrics used to evaluate the business are: Streaming Households, Streaming Hours, ARPU (Average Revenue Per User), and Free Cash Flow.
• Starting with the first quarter of 2025, the company will no longer report quarterly updates on Streaming Households and ARPU.
• The company's primary focus is now on growing revenue of its platform segment and Adjusted EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation, and Amortization).
• As of the first quarter of 2025, the key performance metrics will be: Streaming Hours, Platform Revenue, Adjusted EBITDA, and Free Cash Flow.
• The company defines Streaming Households as distinct user accounts that have streamed content on its platform within the last 30 days.

Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Di.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk section of ROKU's content:

• An increase or decrease in interest rates of 100 basis points on ROKU's cash and cash equivalents balance would increase or decrease their interest income by approximately $21.6 million.

• Most of ROKU's revenue is generated within the United States, resulting in minimal foreign currency risk related to revenue.

• The company's foreign currency risk primarily relates to operating expenses, cash balances, and lease liabilities denominated in currencies other than U.S. dollars (primarily British pounds and Euros).

• Fluctuations in net income have resulted from transaction gains or losses related to revaluing monetary asset and liability balances denominated in currencies other than the functional currency of the entities in which they are recorded.

• ROKU has not entered into any derivatives or other financial instruments to hedge their foreign currency exchange risk, but may do so in the future.

Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplem.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from the PART II - Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data section of ROKU's financial statements:

• As of December 31, 2024, the Company has consolidated balance sheets.
• The related consolidated statements of operations, comprehensive loss, stockholders' equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024, are presented.
• The financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Company as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
• The Company's internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024, was audited and found to be operating effectively.
• An unqualified opinion was expressed on the Company's internal control over financial reporting by the independent registered public accounting firm.

Item 9A. Controls and Procedures.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 9A. Controls and Procedures section of ROKU's Annual Report:

• As of December 31, 2024, ROKU's disclosure controls and procedures were effective at the reasonable assurance level.
• There was no change in internal control over financial reporting identified during the evaluation required by Rule 13a-15(d) that occurred during the quarter ended December 31, 2024.
• The effectiveness of ROKU's internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024 has been audited by Deloitte & Touche LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm.
• No evaluation of controls can provide absolute assurance that all control issues and instances of fraud have been detected due to inherent limitations in all control systems.
• ROKU's internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and preparation of financial statements for external purposes.

Item 10. Directors, Executive Officers a.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART III - Item 10. Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance section of ROKU's Annual Report:

• The information required by this item is incorporated by reference to the sections "Voting and Meeting Information," "Board of Directors and Corporate Governance," "Executive Officer Biographies," and "Other Matters" in ROKU's definitive Proxy Statement for the 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.

• ROKU's policies and procedures governing the purchase, sale, and other dispositions of securities by insiders are filed as Exhibit 19.1 to this Annual Report.

Item 15. Exhibits and Financial Statemen.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART IV - Item 15. Exhibits and Financial Statement Schedules section of ROKU's Annual Report, formatted as bullet points:

• The Index to Financial Statements is located in Item 8 of this Annual Report.
• All financial statement schedules have been omitted due to not being required under related instructions or being non-applicable.
• The documents listed as exhibits are furnished with the Annual Report but are not deemed filed with the SEC and are not incorporated by reference.

Item 16. Form 10-K Summary.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART IV - Item 16. Form 10-K Summary section:

• The ROKU's Annual Report on Form 10-K was signed by Anthony Wood and Dan Jedda, who serve as attorneys-in-fact for the company.
• The signing took place on February 14th, 2025.
• The report was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in connection with the annual report.
